reviewText: This very interesting documentary covers the life of a great poet and lover of liberty. It includes many comments by several well known contempory artists. I enjoyed it tremendously, along a deep sense of nostalgia.

An evocative documentary with effective use of sight & sound. My first introduction to an apparently world-class poet. Search on Amazon and in typically extensive holdings of large local public library system results in zero items for further reading. How culture bound are we oh so sophisticated North American readers?
